23325110.review:
[b][h1]Meine Review zu "Day of the Tentacle Remastered"[/h1][/b]

[b][u]Vorwort[/u][/b]
Day of the Tentacle habe ich bereits in meiner Kindheit sehr geliebt. Als ich dann erfur, dass es ein Remake geben wird war ich natürlich voller Vorfreude. Natürlich hatte ich auch bedenken, da nicht jedes Remake gut ist (Bsp.: Monkey Island 1 und 2 Special Edition: Die Spiele kann man zwar in der Retro und in der neuen Version spielen, jedoch wurde die Retro Version nicht übersetzt und die Grafik der überarbeiteten Version ist sehr gewöhnungsbedürftig). 
Jedoch sind alle meine Bedenken unbegründet. Ich bin vom Remake begeistert!

[b][u]Über das Spiel[/u][/b]
Day of The Tentacle ist der zweite Teil der klassischen Point & Click Reihe "Maniac Mansion" von Lucas Arts. Das Spiel punktet mit sehr viel Humor und einigen Easter Eggs. Zudem befinden wir uns in der Bekannten Pension aus Teil 1 und es gibt bekannte Charakter (Spielbare: Bernard, Nicht Spielbare: Dr. Fred, seine Frau Schwester Edna und sein Sohn Ed Edison). In diesem Remake dieses Spieles kann man zwischen der Retro Version und der neuen HD Version mit der F1 Taste wechseln. Zudem gibt es nun auch Entwicklerkommentare.

[b][u]Story[/u][/b]
Dr. Fred Edison hat die Chemikalien seiner Matsch Maschine in den Fluss vor dessen Pension geschüttet. Purpur Tentakel (ein von Fred Edison erschaffenes Tentakelwesen) trinkt diese Chemikalien und Mutiert zu einem bösen Wesen, dass die Weltherrschaft an sich reißen will. Aus diesem Grund will Dr. Fred die Tentakel (auch den guten Grün Tentakel) töten.
Bernard, Laverne und Hoagie, die gemeinsam in einer WG wohnen, erfahren davon durch einen Brief von Grün Tentakel. Zu dritt fahren sie zu Dr. Fred's Pension um die Tentakel zu befreien. Doch durch das Befreien flieht Purpur und schmiedet Pläne für die Weltherrschaft.
Damit Purpur Tentakel erst gar nicht diese Chemikalien trinken kann, werden die 3 in die Vergangenheit teleportiert um zu verhindern, dass die Chemikalie in den Fluss geschüttet wird. Doch bei der Zeitreise geht einiges schief und ein witziges Abenteuer beginnt...

[b][u]Steuerung[/u][/b]
Je nachdem ob man die Klassische oder die neue Variante spielt ist die Steuerung etwas anders. In der klassischen Variante befindet sich links unten die Interaktionsbox, rechts unten das Inventar. In der HD Version befindet sich das Inventar unten links, wenn man mit der Maus in die linke Ecke des Bildschirms fährt. Eine Interaktionsbox gibt es hier nicht mehr. Mit dem Mausrad wählt man zwischen den verschiedenen Interaktionen und mit der linken Maustaste führt man diese aus.

[b][u]Rätsel[/u][/b]
An den Rätseln wurde in der HD Version nichts geändert. Dies finde ich persönlich sehr gut. Die Rätsel sind im Grunde einfach bis knifflig. Im Spielverlauf muss man ab zwischendurch Objekte unter den Charakteren tauschen. Dies geht einfach in dem man das Chron-O-John benutzt oder das Objekt mit dem Bild des jeweiligen Charakters benutzt.


[b][u]Musik und Sound[/u][/b]
Die bekannte Musik des Klassikers ist geblieben, wurde nur etwas überarbeitet. Im Menü kann man auswählen ob man die Musik des Remakes oder die klassische Musik wählen will, oder jeweils die Musik des Spieles will. Wählt man automatisch so hat man die jeweilige passende Musik der Versionen. 
Zudem wurde auch die alte, deutsche Synchro beibehalten. Dies ist für mich ein großer Pluspunkt.

[b][u]Grafik[/u][/b]
Auch das Spiel- und das Charakterdesign des Spieles wurde beibehalten. Lediglich wurde die klassische Pixelgrafik aufgefrischt und in ein modernes HD Design verändert. So bleibt auch in der HD Version der Erkennungswert des Spieles erhalten.

[b][u]Fazit[/u][/b]
Bis auf die HD Grafik, der etwas bearbeiteten Musik und der etwas umgestellten Steuerung in der HD Version wurde an dem Spiel nicht viel verändert, auch die alte Synchro wurde beibehalten. Die Rätsel sollten jedem Nostalgiker noch gut bekannt sein. Allgemein sind die Rätsel nicht sehr schwierig.
Für alle Nostalgiker, die das Originalspiel auf den neuen Rechnern nicht mehr spielen können ist das Spiel ein Pflichtkauf. Aber auch Neueinsteiger des Point & Click Genres, die z. B. die Daedalic Spiele lieben werden bei diesem Remake viel Spaß haben!

23321755.review: MUST SAVE THE WORLD from purple tentacle. Best point and click game ever made, hands down. Also, it includes the first game too.

23269634.review:
[h1]An old classic that's fresher than lots of today's titles.[/h1]

[i]Day of the Tentacle[/i] first launched in 1993. I remember, because I was a teenager then and couldn't play it as my PC didn't meet the minimum requirements! This was actually the sequel to an earlier game, [i]Maniac Mansion[/i], which was released in 1987. I played [i]Maniac Mansion[/i] a few years after it came out, but did not complete it as the game's movement and controls were just too dated and clunky for me (even back then) to be bothered with. 

Playing [i]Maniac Mansion[/i] is not at all necessary in order to enjoy [i]Day of the Tentacle[/i], though those who have will definitely find greater connection to the game's characters, especially the Edison family.

23 years later, [i]Day of the Tentacle Remastered[/i] is essentially the same as it was before, but with sleeker graphics and a more modernised interface. While the story hasn't changed, it surprisingly (or not) hasn't aged one bit either - tentacle mutates and seeks to conquer the world, and only you (and your friends) can stop him! Though straightforward, the game's charm is in its various amusing time travel locations and the weird and wonderful characters you meet along the way. This is a prime example of where [i]"it's all about the journey, not the destination."[/i]


[h1]Yays![/h1]

+ Vibrant, colourful, hi-res cartoon-style graphics.
+ Well-designed rooms, locations and scenery.
+ Fully voiced, with good voice acting for the most part. (The guy who plays Dr Fred is awesome.)
+ Interesting, memorable characters.
+ Fun, amusing story.
+ Wacky humour.
+ Clear goals.
+ Cool easter eggs. (Under "achievements".)
+ Contains a free game ([i]Maniac Mansion[/i])!
+ Puzzles are mostly enjoyable and require some creative thinking.
+ Many gameplay hours.
+ Trading cards.

[h1]Nays.[/h1]

- [url=steamcommunity.com/app/388210/discussions/0/392184522713202518/]Audio starts stuttering[/url] after a while, due to memory problems.
- Achievements remain hidden, even after the game is completed, so you can't see what you're missing.
- Some puzzles have illogical or nonsensical solutions.
- Bugs: e.g. When looking at one of the items, Laverne's voice sounds when Bernard speaks.
- No mouse command to fast-forward dialogue; instead, you have to press "." which is really inconvenient, especially when the whole point of a point-n-click game is to [i]not[/i] have to use your keyboard!
- Some counter-intuitive puzzle set-ups: E.g. For the videotape puzzle, a button which looks like the "STOP" button, is actually the "RECORD" button. Anyone who's ever used a VCR or tape recorder would know that the square symbol denotes "STOP", while the round button denotes "RECORD". 
- Hoagie's periodic belches sound absolutely disgusting!


[h1]Conclusion[/h1]

This was a hugely enjoyable experience from start to finish. Though the nostalgia factor played a part in my case, even if you've never heard of the [i]Maniac Mansion[/i] series, as long as you count yourself a point-n-click adventure game fan, this is a must-play because it just gets so many things right. Add to that the timeless plot and wacky characters, and you have yourself a game that will play just as fresh & new decades down the road.


[table]
    [tr]
        [td][u]Disclaimer:[/u] [i]Game played for free, with many thanks to my dear friend [url=steamcommunity.com/id/kflorence]KFlo[/url]. :)[/i][/td]
    [/tr]
[/table]

23195752.review:
[h1]Double Fine's remastered edition of [url=store.steampowered.com/app/388210/]Day of the Tentacle[/url] is all about preserving the integrity of the original version rather than offering a creative reinterpretation. Unlike the first two Monkey Island remakes, which boasted new backgrounds and updated art direction, this version remains largely intact, if only in sharper resolution.[/h1]

It is a pure pleasure to rediscover the cheerful and silly world of the game. With over two decades since my first playthrough I've forgotten most puzzle solutions and dialogues. Everything holds perfectly well today. The humor and story are unblemished, and while the game is clearly a product of its time it should still appeal to both newcomers and nostalgic old-timers.

The more creative puzzles are almost always sensible. You'll spend the first chunk of the game mainly exploring the three different time periods and then start putting things together, working on multiple concurrent threads until the big finale. Just the right amount of hints are given through dialogues to guide players. Moreover, you can't mess up or fail so playing is always an enjoyable and stress-free experience.

One of the game's main strengths is offering a substantial amount of diversity within the same location only by adding or removing 200 years. The plot introduces more than one ingenious way to swap or transport items from the different time periods and everything is just generally well conceived.

The three main characters are obviously controlled by an omniscient being (the player) since they collaborate closely without ever communicating directly with each other, often performing actions that make no sense in their specific timeline except for those on the receiving end hundreds of years apart. The game's wholly implausible setting and absurd scenario are all part of its charm.

LucasArts' original interface has always been messy, with its over-abundant action verbs that failed to add any proper value to the gameplay. For instance, there is never any need for both Open and Close commands as contextually only one of the two will ever make sense, if it were not for the game's insistence on crafting plausible sentences. This made sense in the early days of adventure gaming when players actually had to type out full commands on the keyboard, and it was a good solution in its time but it feels awkwardly dated by today's standards. I wish Double Fine had made more of an effort to streamline the UI, though its new action dial interface is imperfectly sufficient I suppose.

If I were to be picky, I'd mention some of the animation cells were poorly uprezed, with subtle alpha channel issues visible around some character edges or other animated parts. Not all background details appear lovingly hand-painted, revealing some skewed or hard edges that were not intentional in the source art, and places where the classic's limited color palette now show signs of age. The new art trades a bit of pixelated grittiness in favor of clean flat shading. The game still looks fantastic nonetheless and it is especially great to be able to finally enjoy it full screen and without the immense list of cluttered words at the bottom.

The makeover's new hot spot highlight system does not work on animated objects. It feels like a rushed job.

Day of the Tentacle was and remains one of my favorite adventure games. I still have the original odd pyramid-shaped box accumulating dust in my collection, and I'm definitely happy that Double Fine gave me an excellent reason to revisit this timeless classic.

23017623.review:
So one of my all-time favourite games got a remastered edition.
Is the return to a vectorized mansion worth it, for beginners and fans?

The story: You have to save the world from evil purple tentacle - as three different characters. However, while using time machines two of the group get stranded in the past and future by accident and they have to return to present first.

The original game from 1993 can be called one of the best adventure games ever made. It combined wonderful cartoonish graphics, great puzzles, loveable funny characters, wonderful music, a lot of humour and an amusing time travel story into one. 
The reboot does pretty much the same thing.
To be honest: Hardly anything has changed. There is no "Wow!" effect like in other remakes like "Ducktales Remastered". However, I am going to point out the differences...

The first change you notice is - of course - the graphics, now sharp and vectorized. This really looks great and makes the game look a bit more cartoonish without taking away the charme of the original graphics.
Also the music and sound effects seemed to have a little make-over. 
The voices are the same as in the original, so there is no re-recording.

But do the changes please you?
As I said, the vectorized graphics are very fine.
But when it comes to the sound effects I wished there was a bit more effort put into it. They seem to be selected lazily out of a small sound library. For instance: The same sound effect is used for a reception bell and a ray gun. In some sequences random cartoon sound effects, if they fit at all or not, were put in. You may find this funny but I felt that this could be done better and more careful. Also, in sequences when characters laugh or scream there's still silence which is weird in a remake/reboot.
But that's nitpicking, to be honest.

The gameplay is fine and easy enough. The difference is that there's no text field at the bottom with verbs anymore ("Use", "Look", "Talk to"...). Instead you can either use the keyboard or mouse (or both) to control the game. A click on something/somebody with the right mouse button for example shows you the actions you can do here. A pop up menu at the bottom shows you your intenvory and the other characters (time periods) to switch to.

The other differences is the bonus material: an audio commentary track starring the makers of the game (like Tim Schafer), the option to switch to original/remastered graphics, beautiful concept art from 1992, 58 achievements and Steam trading cards.
They are all nice and if you play through the game you should get most of the achievements since they're often connected to puzzles you have to solve anyway. 

Since I am German and there are probably other German-speaking users reading this: There's also the option to change to a German audio track. However, personally I prefer the English one. The German has some good chosen voices but others just don't fit, for instance Bernard (the voice actor sounds way too handsome and uninterested as Bernard, sorry). Also I'm not quite satisfied with the German subtitles. They seem to be just wrong sometimes like the translator wasn't paying attention. Here are some examples:
"awesome" -> "schrecklich" (terrible)
"sushi platter" -> "Sushi-Teig" (sushi batter)
"beef jerky" -> "Bonbons" (candies)
"That's gross!" -> "Das ist toll!" (That's great!)
So if you're German and can at least understand the English audio track then you are definitely on the inside track.

So, does "Day of the Tentacle Remastered" pay off? 
I say: Yes. It's still damn funny and entertaining, a heartwarming return to the mansion.
If you are a fan already you will certainly feel the same and also discover the bonus material and try to get all achievements.
If you have never experienced "DOTT" this is a great opportunity to try out this classic that has aged very well (including the prequel "Maniac Mansion" from 1987 which can be played inside this game!). But prepare for some sophisticated puzzles which force you to think laterally pretty much all the time. However, it's not frustrating and lots of puzzles themselves were designed in a funny way, too.

Grab your Chron-O-John and have a good time! Or three.

22997854.review:
[b]"Well, what possible harm could one insane, mutant tentacle do?"[/b]

Beside taking over the world? Not much, but it sure is enough to get our protagonists (the nerdy Bernard, the wanna-be-rockstar Hoagie and the not-so-attractive Laverne) contact Dr. Fred Edison for a solution. 3 mobile toilets serve as time machines to take them back to yesterday where they can turn off a machine that causes pollution and is responsible for making the tentacle creatures grow hands. 

[b]"I  think I've made myself totally clear, Step one: Find Plans, Step two: Save World, Step three: Get out of my house! Let's get cracking!"[/b]

Sounds simple, but in reality, it is not! The time machines all malfunction and while Bernard finds himself in the present Hoagie meets the American Founding Fathers back in colonial times and Laverne finds herself in a tentacle-infested future where human beings are considered no more than pets.

I like how you get to explore the same mansion / inn in 3 different times. While the objects / pieces of furniture / inhabitants are different, the layout / design remain the same. In fact, it's funny how you have the same grandfather clock in all locations and you get to see the mummy guy with all three of them. The goal is, naturally, to reverse the mess caused by Edison's faulty "science experiment" so that our heroes can meet once more to go back in time again!

[b]"Bernard, float over here so I can punch you!"[/b]

I wholeheartedly agree! But LucasArts we'll not get a punch since they teamed up with Double Fine Productions to release this game once more but more than 20 years later. Similarly to the Monkey Island remastered editions they got rid of the bottom part of the screen which listed all the actions we could do (and covered a major portion of the display) and thanks to the greater resolution we do not find any pixelated characters / objects any more. I like how we can quickly change between the classic and the remastered render on the go by pressing F1.

Beside the graphical and audio enhancements we can turn on the developer commentaries. From time to time a pop-up tells us to press a button so that we can hear what they want to say: sometimes it's lots of factual information on the development and the technological limitations they had back then, at other times they compliment each other for the jokes / cutscenes / music and crack some jokes themselves. I preferred the latter to the technological mumbo-jumbo.

[b]"We may not live to see yesterday..."[/b]

Well, we get to see lots of achievements - some are very well hidden. The game forces you to look at all things and converse with all characters. Since many of these are missable you'll surely come back for a 2nd or even for a 3rd round. Oh, and in case you did not know: Day of The Tentacle is the sequel to Maniac Mansion, another oldie but goldie from LucasArts. In Bernard's storyline you can find a working PC and using it allows you to play this game! What a nice gesture and homage! And also what an annoying achievement hidden right there...

With the Monkey Island, Grim Fandango and Day of The Tentacle remastered I just need them to finish Full Throttle as well as Indiana Jones The Fate of Atlantis. There's no better pastime than replaying the classic point-and-click games on modern PCs!

Ayssss... que hermosos recuerdos de mi infancia me trae este juego! Junto con la saga Monkey Island y otros similares de la desaparecida Lucas Arts...

Maniac Mansion y su secuela Day of the Tentacle marcaron a una generación de niños y adolescentes que nos iniciabamos por aquel entonces en el mundo de los videojuegos...

Si perteneces a aquella época y jugaste a este juego, te encantará el remake! 

Afortunadamente en esta ocasión el remake es de verdad. Igual que se hizo con los dos primeros Monkey Island, el remake ha implicado el rediseño de todos los graficos del juego escena por escena, personaje por personaje, animacion por animación... se ha vuelto a grabar la banda sonora, voces de los personajes (solo en inglés), etc. 

Esto no sucedía con otros remakes de clasicos como Grim Fandango... en cuyo caso se limitaron a ofrecer el mismo juego pero poniendole un marco al rededor de la pantalla para pasar de una resolucion de 840x600 a una panoramica... vamos, nada! 

En este caso todo se ha redibujado y se agradece aunque ya de por si los graficos de la epoca para aquel entonces estaban muy bien :)

En resumen, si eres un nostalgico de la época este juego no puede faltar en tu colección... y si no eres un nostalgico igualmente te invito a jugarlo, seguro que te encantará! :D

The concept-art is burner! <3
The game itself... its Day of the tentacle, including Maniac Mansion, simply.

Fullscreen is nice and the menuhandling is very easy. Languages of voice and subtitles are configurable separately. 
They did a good work with the remake, but since I am nostalgic, I think the original pixel-graphics still have more "character". Same as with the Monkey Island remake back then. At least the new DOTT-design is much closer to the original.

DOTT is  very easy to play, since its a new-age puzzle, what means you cant die or do anything wrong (beside missing an achievement). 
If you never played Maniac Mansion and are curious what feeling it was to play an adventure back in the past, then you should give it a try. The handling may confuse you a little bit, but hey; thats how it was back then. But attention: in the old adventures like Maniac Mansion it IS possible to f*ck up the whole game by doing something wrong or even die! ;) 

Over the years it may be the fourth time I buy this game. If you never played it, you can easily spend 10 €/$ for it. Its worth the money.
If you played and payed the game already, I would really think this over, if you want to spent 10 or even more  €/$ again for a STEAM-game (if its worth to you to buy steam-bound games at all).

So, have fun meeting the Edison-Family (again)! ;)

This game was the first game I;ve ever played in my life. 

I used to go to my best friend house back in the day, we were just kids, and so, he had 3 games, Fury 3, Barbie modeling (his sister game) and DOTT.

Back then we didn't know any English at all, still that didnt stop us to play this masterpiece. 

The feeling of solving a puzzle was something I cannot erase from my memories. I actually remember pretty well when we solved the left hand statue puzzle, we were happy as fuck. 

I remember how badly we wanted to get Laverne out of the three, sadly we never ended the game due to being so difficult and the lack of language. 

In 2010, I solved the game by myself with the ScummVM Version, I felt so good beating the game without any guide or similar, took me a week, but it was totally worth it.

And now 2016, the Remastered version was released.'

Insta buy for me.

10/10, One of the best games of the gold era of adventure games, when devs got  inpired and let their imagination flow into their creations. (nowadays its all copy of the copy of the copy aka: Cod)

A must have in your steam collection.

22870913.review:
Review Completo: http://criticalhits.com.br/day-of-the-tentacle-remastered-review/

Day of the Tentacle segue sendo um dos maiores adventure games da história e é sem dúvida um jogo para se colocar na lista de jogos para jogar antes de morrer. Mesmo 23 anos após seu lançamento o jogo segue tendo um gameplay único que funciona de maneira simples e genial que deixa todas as ações na mão do jogador mas não dá nenhuma dica do que deve ser feito.

Seu visual remasterizado pode não agradar todos os fãs do jogo original e para isso ele possui a opção de alternar entre a versão original e a nova, atendendo a qualquer um que o jogue. Seu som completamente em alta definição agradará a qualquer um e é um deleite para os ouvidos. A jogabilidade recebeu mudanças providenciais que facilitam e muito a vida do jogador. O novíssimo suporte a controles faz a ação de jogá-lo ser tão confortável quanto jogar no teclado.

O jogo segue sendo capaz de arrancar boas gargalhadas e possui uma história tão bem escrita que ainda impressiona. Você VAI querer jogar Day of the Tentacle Remastered e após ele você VAI querer jogar Maniac Mansion, que continua disponível dentro de seu antecessor.

Prós:
    História simples e bem feita
    Sistema de puzzles segue sendo único e genial
    Seleção de diálogos que ajudam o jogador
    Jogabilidade aprimorada
    Visual em alta definição e som reajustado
    Possibilidade de alternar entre versão remasterizada e clássica com apenas um comando
    Possui uma versão jogável de Maniac Mansion

Contras:
    Não possui sistema de sugestões
    Sem legendas em português

[b] Day of the Tentacle Remastered is a rerelease of one of the most beloved Point & Click Adventures ever created. [/b]

[h1]For my full review, please visit[/h1] [url=http://feedmepixels.com/day-of-the-tentacle/] Feed Me Pixels[/url]

The Remastered Day of the Tentacle has kept everything the fans loved about the original; the story, the voice overs, the music and even the animal cruelty! Giving us the same product we appreciated in 1993. Improvements were made to the graphics, the audio quality, the interface and commentary from some of the developers was added as a bonus. For those who hate all forms of change, good and bad; the game can be played with the original pixelated graphics, the verb bar, and slightly fuzzier audio.[spoiler]Even the Easter Eggs are still there.[/spoiler] 

[h1]Pros: [/h1]
[list]
[*] Beautiful art
[*] Satisfying gameplay
[*] Hilarious voice acting
[*] Excellent plot and engaging story
[*] Available over numerous platforms
[*] Added commentary for the chronically curious
[*] Smoothed out graphics and Audio that preserved the original
[*] Oh how we missed you DoTT (it's still there underneath it all, the same game)
[/list]
[h1]Cons: [/h1]
[list]
[*] Limited replay value
[*] New players can get stuck (no hint system)
[*] [strike]May not be available on Xbox for a while to come[/strike]
[/list]

[table]
    [tr]
        [th][h1]Overall score:              [/h1][/th]

Großartiges Remaster, die neu gezeichneten 2D Sprites sehen wirklich knackig und frisch aus, sind aber dennoch orginalgetreu zur alten Pixelgrafik. Ebenfalls super ist, das Quasi alles beim alten geblieben ist, alle alten Rätsel sind geblieben ohne noch irgend einen extra schnick schnack einzubauen welcher nicht an die Qualität der Orginalrätsel ran kommen würde, auch toll dass man die alte Syncro drinnen gelassen hat und man eine Neuvertonung in Frage gekommen ist (auch wenn man manchmal ein Rauschen bei manchen Soundfiles hören konnte, etwas mehr Sound restaurierung hätte nicht geschadet), Musik wurde zwar neu eingespielt, aber wie auch bei der Grafik wurde darauf geachtet dass es orginalgetreu bleibt, ich musste manchmal sogar zur Orginal version hin und her switchen (was auch mit nur einem Tastendruck möglich ist, super!) um überhaupt einen Unterschied rauszuhören zu können.

Allgemein habe ich zwar das Spiel in der Orginalfassung schon vor gut 5 Jahren durchgespielt, aber in der Zeit sind mir bis auf ein paar basic Rätsel und kniffe doch nur recht wenig im Kopf geblieben, sodass ich für das gesammte Spiel gut 5 Stunden brauchte, hätte ich das nicht gehabt wären es bestimmt 7 daraus geworden, und für das sind die 15€ es auf jedenfall wert! 22735332.review:
First off, I am thrilled this game exists, so thank you for that. When I saw that Double Fine had plans to remake some of the old LucasArts games, this one was at the top of my list.

To date, I have played both of the Double Fine remakes (Grim Fandango and this game) and I would say that because of the original format of the game, this one has aged much better. Even with updated graphics, Grim felt a bit dated and I didn't feel the remastered version added much for me having played through the original multiple times. This game, however, I feel has greatly benefited from being remastered, much like the Monkey Island series games. The sound is crisp and clear, the scenes are beautiful and more detailed than they were before. Basically, the game has retained all the awesome of the original with the added benefit of being visually and aurally more appealing.

Bottom line, if you like point and click adventure games centered around fascinating, humorous and quirky story lines with a little bit of time travel and historical fiction mixed in, you won't want to miss this one. And if you're just feeling nostalgic for another playthrough, there is enough added value from the remastering to make the game really come to life again.

22719908.review: Yes, finally. Another early 90s Point & Click, that has been Remastered by Double Fine. This Game is awesome in every way you look at it. They nailed the cartoony Style, funny Characters and ridiculous Animations. Puzzles are insanely hard, you will probably need a Guide to experience the Story. This is the prime example, that the Games back then were better than they are today. You can tell right away, this Game has been made with Passion. It is a similar Remaster that has been made for the Monkey Island Series. Im happy that the Remaster didnt change that much from the Original and sticked by its Lore. If your a total Nerd, you can get DOS Box and play it how it originally was. Hopefully we have more of these coming up.

22636684.review:
[b]If you think I missed something in my review feel free to tell me [/b]

[h1] Day of the Tentacle Remastered [/h1] 

Day of the Tentacle Remastered is an adventure game that was originally released June 25, 1993 and now it has come back in a beautiful way. I will add a TL;DR at the end.

[h1] Gameplay [/h1] 

In Day of the Tentacle you manage three different characters alongside three different timelines. Your actions will affect the future and you will be using items across the centuries to slowly advance through the game, and stop a maniacal purple tentacle who is going to take over the world and enslave humanity. 

The game has you go back and forth between different locations and slowly advance through the plot. Day of the Tentacle has plenty of humour to keep your attention, and contains a rather long playthrough for someone who has not had the opportunity to play the original.

Within the game there is a developer commentary to allows people to actually hear the developers comment upon the game as you play through it (although it does cut off the natural game so I did not use it).

[h1] Graphics/Sounds[/h1] 

Something to love about this version of Day of the Tentacle is that you have the ability to switch between the classic music and graphics or the remastered version. The remastered version has done a great job of polishing the graphics. The animations of characters doing certain objectives and the music make the game seem nostalgic and cartoonish making you appreciate how a game, even though it originally was released so long ago, is better than most adventure games we have today.

[h1] Pros/Cons[/h1] 

[b] Pros [/b] 

+ Long playthrough with enjoyable dialogue 
+ Option for remastered or classic version
+ Interesting plot and objectives
+ Three different and unique characters and three different periods of time
+ Colorful characters
+ Humorous 

[b] Cons [/b] 

- Text delay within cutscenes in certain areas (Text cannot catch up to voice)
- Slight graphical glitch (Only seen once though)

[h1] Final Thoughts[/h1] 

I am not part of the nostalgic group who played this game when it was first released however I can easily say that this game is a true achievement as an adventure game. Day of the Tentacle holds quite a long playthrough for one clueless such as myself and  I love the comedy, all the different characters, the villains, the dialogue, it's simply a good adventure game, and sadly we do not see vey much of those these days.

[h1] TL;DR[/h1] 

If you played this game in 1993 I would urge getting the remastered version if you have not already. If you never played the game, and like adventure games with comedy, try the game out. You will not regret it. There are even star wars jokes within it, there is no other way to say it than this is a beautiful game that has been remastered to shine again.


[b]**[u] Key was provided by developer for review purposes [/u]**[/b] 

[i]If you liked this review or want to see more recommended games, be sure to follow our curator group: [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/Original_Curators_Group#curation]Follow Original Curator Group[/url][/i]

22586833.review:
Well over a decade ago, a friend and I were chatting about this game and how cool it would be if someone released a touched up version of it. We're both huge fans of the game and have played it on numerous occasions. To say that I was excited that Day of the Tentacle Remastered was being released would be an understatement.

The graphics and sound have been enhanced quite nicely, but remain faithful to the original. You have the option to switch between the HD and classic looks, so anyone who feels ultra-nostalgic can play with the original VGA interface.

Yes, it includes the original Maniac Mansion easter egg; I haven't tackled it myself, so I can't really comment, but it's there.

For fans of the original, this is definitely a worthwhile purchase.

If you've never played Day of the Tentacle, but are into adventure / quest games, then I highly recommend that you give this a try. It's charming, funny and has quite a few brilliantly thought out puzzles.

22479497.review:
Brividi! Emozioni! Non ci sono altre parole per descrivere quello che, per me, è stato un gradito ritorno all'infanzia, al mio primo videogame mai affrontato da solo, durante i primi anni delle elementari! (in realtà ci sarebbero i giochi per Commodore 64, ma ero ancora molto piccolo, attento osservatore delle gesta videoludiche dei miei genitori, e quindi non contano!)

Sul gioco, spendo poche parole: sì, si tratta di un'avventura grafica nuda e cruda, un pezzo da 90 del periodo d'oro Lucasarts, e sì, si tratta di un demenziale delirio dall'inizio alla fine, tra scienziati caffeinomani, vecchiette buttate giù dalle scale, mummie concorsiste, e chi più ne ha più ne metta. 

I più critici sono soliti obiettare che il pinnacolo narrativo Lucas sia ben altrove (The Dig, Grim Fandango...), ma è proprio questo il punto: Day Of The Tentacle, al contrario di molte sue imitazioni, non inganna il giocatore con false e trombonesche promesse, ma lo invita attraverso una lunga commedia surreale a sfondo fantascientifico dai tempi comici pressoché perfetti. Giocare per credere: vi sfido a non ridere alle cadute di Bernard mentre cerca di salvare il dottor Fred, o ai commenti al vetriolo di Benjamin Franklin sul quoziente intellettivo di Hoagie (anche se in realtà tutto il lavoro di scrittura andrebbe premiato per freschezza e inventiva).

Il lavoro di restyling ha saputo ridare ulteriore giovinezza a un titolo comunque immortale: i fondali e i personaggi si presentano ora in tutto il loro decompresso splendore, nel pieno rispetto delle intenzioni originali degli autori. Se prima i pixel sembravano solo suggerire il mood cartoonesco dell'insieme, ora di suggestioni non c'è più bisogno: eccolo, questo pseudo-cartone Warner, che prorompe in tutta la sua potenza umoristica!

Discreto ed essenziale il lavoro svolto sul fronte del sonoro: anziché arricchire il corredo audio con una colonna sonora registrata con strumenti acustici, o comunque con delle librerie sonore più moderne, i ragazzi di Double Fine si sono limitati a riprendere e rimasterizzare le musiche MIDI originali (quelle che adoperano i vecchi soundbank della Roland, se non vado errato). Non che il risultato finale sia malvagio, ma sarebbe stato interessante assistere a un lavoro di riammodernamento più ambizioso anche su questo fronte.

Il doppiaggio riprende, decompressi, i file audio dei voice talent originali in tutta la loro chiarezza cristallina. A tutte le lamentele di coloro che avrebbero voluto un doppiaggio in italiano, dico: meglio così! Piuttosto che ritrovarsi con delle interpretazioni macchiettistiche e imbarazzanti (e, per piacere, non tiriamo fuori la storiella dei "migliori doppiatori del mondo", perché è un ritornello che non funziona più), tanto meglio riavere, nella sua qualità primigenia, il doppiato originale che, pur non essendo eccezionale, è più che funzionale alla natura caricaturale del gioco.

Non posso che concludere con un perentorio "prendetelo!". Prendetelo, e non ve ne pentirete. Chi l'ha già affrontato, avrà modo di rivivere un titolo fondamentale del passato videoludico in una nuova, sgargiante veste, che annulla e supera le limitazioni tecniche proprie della tecnologia dei primi anni '90. Chi, invece, ancora non l'ha fatto, avrà la fortuna e l'onore di incontrare una gemma, un piccolo capolavoro, e di esperire un gameplay forse a prima vista lento, ma appagante e in grado di divertire, e di conoscere altresì una logica di ideazione videoludica ben diversa da quella di oggi, quando poche persone, chiuse in una stanza, potevano partorire, con pochissimi mezzi, titoli in grado di fare la storia, mentre programmazione e scrittura andavano tranquillamente di pari passo, mano nella mano.

22336529.review:
I played the 'original' version of DOTT years back, and always remembered how great of a time I had playing it. Things that have always stood out is the art style, the writing in general, and the voice ating (*perfectly* cast voice actors) -- and just how amazingly all these different elements fuse together. 

This new remastered version sounds a lot better, looks a lot better -- and has all the charm that everyone remembers.
If they had an animated series that looked like this game & had its same soul...I would watch it in a second. This coming from a guy who doesn't watch TV at all!  

While this is technically a sequel to Maniac Mansion, you do not need to have played the original Maniac Mansion in order to enjoy this game. As the ultimate 'extra', however, the entire first game is 'BUILT-IN' to this one -- you find an old 'computer' in the game, which gives you acesss to it. Thus, you have the option of revisiting the first game in the series, if you so choose. I did play & finish that game years and years ago on the original NES, and while I remember really enjoying it, the story I do not recall -- but I did not feel at all lost playing Day of the Tentacle. 

Overall, I can't recommend this game any more highly. It really is one of the high-points (if not the highest) in the Adventure Game genre, and stands apart from the rest in all the ways it oozes with charm -- enough ooze to sprout two tentacle arms!

[i]Day of the Tentacle Remastered[/i] looks great, sounds great and plays great -- and it's guaranteed to make you smile!  It's essentially a 23 year-old game, but it's worth every bit of the asking price and then some.  A real classic in every regard!

Este sigue el mismo patrón... Y si eres como yo seguramente has seguido el mismo patrón:
[olist]
    [*]Te pasas el juego entero con gráficos remasterizados cambiando con el F1 varias veces para hacer la obligada comparativa entre nostalgia y renueve.
    [*]Una vez te los has pasado entero, vuelves a jugarlo con los comentarios de los desarrolladores activados para enterarte de todas las cositas que había detrás de esta gran joya.
    [*]Y si todavía te quedan ganas, vuelves a pasártelo en un SPEED RUN para intentar conseguir todos los logros haciendo cosas que recordabas de la primera vez que lo jugaste (como meter al hamster en el microondas como en el MANIAC MANSION original.
[/olist]

Sin lugar a dudas, recomendadísimo. NOSTALGIA RULES!!!!!

Épico es decir poco. Jamás olvidaré mis primeras carcajadas hablando con George Washington y su dentadura postiza que le dimos de repuesto... BUARNS!!!!

DOTT is probably one of Lucasarts' finest adventures. I have so many fond memories of playing this game way back in the day on my dad's PC.

So, how is the remastered version, you wonder? In one word: perfect. I like the remastered art and the improved music (basically better instrument samples). The art is in a higher resolution and keeps all of the design and style of the originals art intact. This is nothing like the Monkey Island 1 and 2 remasters. The optional commentary is interesting and integrated well into the game. As was promised, you really can mix and match options to play the game in the way you prefer. I heartily recommend DOTT Remastered. This is how you remaster a classic adventure!

22162955.review:
For me the original Day of the Tentacle (sometimes called Manic Mansion 2) was the best point and click adventure game of the 90's; with the second best being Indiana Jones and the Fate of Atlantis or the Curse of Monkey Island, or wait Beneath a Steel Sky was great too.. man there were so many great games in the 90's.  

Much of the plot and steps needed in the puzzles came flooding back as soon as I started playing, but for those not aware or familiar with the original should expect mind bending puzzles but a good and enjoyable time with a lot of laughs.  
The game doesn't hold your hand like modern titles.  You'll need to think on wild tangents.. How to get George Washington to cut down a kumkuat tree for you?.. of course paint it red, he likes cutting down cherry trees (apparently).

This remastered version of the game is faithful to the original even down to the playable version of Maniac Mansion hidden inside.  I never completed the "enhanced" PC version of Maniac Mansion which I got for a birthday in the late 80's; but during my DotT playthough have finally completed it. 

You could probably still find walkthroughs of the game online if needed and blast your way though the entire game in 2 hours.  But I'd say stay clear of the walkthroughs unless you get completely stuck.  It took me about 7 hours to complete DotT and Manic Mansion.

This trip down memory lane was easily worth the price of the game, but even for new players I would recommend it.

More fun than a jump-suit full of weasels. 9/10

22146089.review:
Day of the Tentacle is a great point and click game made by LucasArts. It fits into the same category of the original Monkey Island series. The remake is extremely great, especially the graphics. If you enjoyed the special edition of Monkey Island then this game I would highly recommend. Here is a list about the characteristics of the remake.

A. Gameplay - The gameplay is exactly the same as original. A puzzle to solve, decide what you need to get or do. Try to execute your decision, works or doesn't work.
B. Death - LucasArts games usually don't allow you to die like a first person shooter. If you don't solve the puzzle that fast, then no big deal. Just try something different with the item or action.
C. Humor - There is much humor in this game that ranges from the 90s, silly actions in some spots, and ridiculous dialogue.
D. Time - This game can be won in a single day or less if you already know how to solve the puzzles. I played it hundreds of times when I was a kid so remembering the puzzles from the past made me win the game in about 1 day. If you are new and have a difficult time or if you hit a roadblock you can save and come back.
E. Graphics - The remake turns the pixelated look into a great cartoon feel. The cartoon feel is smooth and nice.
F. Achievements - The remake has some silly achievements that you can get. Some of them just make you laugh.

Overall, the remake is great. I may be a tad biased because I loved this game as a kid but for the newer generation of players it can still be a laugh. Some jokes the younger generation may not get but it is still great fun.

22119852.review:
Threw my wallet at the screen immediately when I saw this. That didn't do anything, so I entered my Paypal information and that seemed to do the trick.

The remastered visuals and music are lovely and totally faithful to the original, and when you hit F1 it changes the game back to its classic pixelated soundblaster goodness (which I still prefer).  It's exactly as I remember it when I was a prepubescent child, only now the sound doesn't skip like crazy and I didn't have to install six floppy disks.  The additional commentary is also enjoyable to listen to and gives a lot of incite on the development of this legendary title.

As for the game itself?  It's a classic.  It's what put Tim Schafer on the map, and one of the best point n' click adventure games ever made, right up there with Gabriel Knight, Fate of Atlantas, Monkey Island, Kings/Space/Police Quests, The Longest Journey, etc.  It's brilliant, and this is the best version yet.  I did, however, run into one bug where the music wasn't playing correctly during the final moments of the game.  Hopefully they'll fix that.  Otherwise, it was problem free.

22117183.review:
Video Review = https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wjS_CUBJa6I

There are only two games that I have played and beat more times that I can count and that’s Max Payne & Day of the Tentacle. My gaming life was started in Atari 8-bit computers, but was groomed with IBM PCs and Lucasfilm & Lucasarts adventure games. Lucas arts adventure games were the main games I played growing up and they shaped my sense of humor and critical thinking skills. Day of the Tentacle is my favorite Lucas arts adventure game and this Remaster is PERFECT.

OVERALL

As far as this I’m concerned in terms of this REMASTER - it is ABSOLUTELY PERFECT. It does what I absolutely love about Remasters and think they all should include this. At any time you can switch back to the original Graphics, music, and sound with a push of a button. Why I particularly love this Remaster as well is because it doesn’t overdo or redo things to a distasteful amount - It’s updated the artwork, smoothing out the pixels, and making Day of the Tentacle Look FANTASTIC in HD. I didn’t particularly enjoy what the Special Edition Monkey Island games did - It kind of lost the original artwork for new artwork - 

The increased resolution improves Peter Chan’s amazing artwork and design and I have to give a big shout out to the lead artist on Day of the Tentacle which is Peter Chan - His artwork and design give Day of the Tentacle it’s mood and voice is you will. I love the quirky angles. and twists and the use of color - I cannot explain it, it’s just perfection.

GAMEPLAY

The gameplay simplifies the old the point and click verb style with removing the verbs and inventory from the screen to just show your cursor and you right click to bring up a radial dial all the available options for you to interact with an object. This simplifies the thought process to a degree; by showing you the available actions for something, but it’s a much quicker way to play and I imagine great for consoles- However - I also thought not seeing your inventory on screen all the time made thinking about puzzles a little harder if you didn’t know what to do whereas seeing the items on screen might help you realize you have a solution for something.

Luckily you can mix and match the art, verb and inventory style, and music anyway you like in the options so you can have the Old point and click verb style with the new HD artwork. I didn’t realize this until I had already played through the standard remaster and this made me even more happy than before, because while I played through the standard settings to experience the remaster, in the future I’ll probably play with old music, old verbs, and new artwork just because I’m an old school guy. 

You still can play the original Maniac Mansion on the commodore 64 computer inside of weird Ed Edison’s room - you can quit anytime and it will autosave your progress. So you’re getting two games for the price of one here.

MUSIC:

Now in my personal opinion I don’t really like the new “remastered” music - I feel like it was a transfer of re-allocating midi instruments and not for the better. Maybe I’m partial to the original, but I just found many times enjoying the original music and also feeling that it was more subtle, less in your face, and worked with the cartoon style and imuse system better. The best way I can give you an example is the difference between how Green Tentacles band sounds when you listen to his track in the video above.

As far as sound effects go, I believe nothing has changed there except bitrate perhaps. And Hat’s off to the voice actors and voice director Tamlynn Barra for making quality voice acting for a 1993 video game. Do you know how long it took other companies to get good voice acting? (Think Final Fantasy X)

Ultimately I am so happy with this Remaster and I highly Recommend to everyone - even if you haven’t heard of played it before or even wondered what an adventure game is since they kind of went away, but have been coming back. Play it! Just play it!

"Day of the Tentacle Remastered" Is a ginuine, classic point and click adventure game with a pizzazz no other game can achieve. This is how you remake a classic game! 22112372.review:
Après avoir terminé le jeu on se rend compte qu'il a plutôt bien vieilli et ce remaster lui fait honneur.

Pour ceux qui n'étaient pas nés à l'époque il s'agit d'un jeu d'aventure point & click assez loufoque où l'on doit empêcher une tentacule pourpre qui a bu de l'eau contaminée de conquérir le monde. 

Le dessin très cartoonesque a été refait et y'a pas un putain de gros pixel qui traîne. C'est du superbe boulot. Le jeu est aussi désormais en plein écran alors qu'avant 1/3 de celui-ci était bouffé par l'interface. On peut donc profiter des décors et des animations en plein écran. Les musiques ont été également réarrangées.

Mais ce qui fait surtout plaisir c'est qu'on peut ne pas profiter des graphismes refaits d'un clic de souris, ou même de profiter de la musique MIDI d'époque plutôt que de celle réorchestrée, et ça c'est bon. ON peut personnaliser osn expérience.

A ça on rajoute les commentaires des développeurs, qui même s'ils sont pas forcément toujours bien trouvés ni intéressants, rajoutent une petite couche sympa pour les curieux.

Bref, que du bon si vous êtes nostalgique ou amateur de point and click :)

22109897.review:
Un remaster honnête du grand classique de Lucas Art. Passage au 16/9, graphismes retravaillés en vectoriel, nouvelle bande originale et interface repensée... de quoi justifier largement les 15 euros demandées. Un simple passage de la nouvelle version à l'ancienne via la touche F1 permet de prendre conscience du chemin parcouru.
La durée de vie est par contre assez courte, n'utilisez la soluce qu'en cas de bloquage sévère (1 ou 2 passages vraiment tirés par les cheveux) sous peine de gâcher le plaisir.

22109578.review:
This game plays exactly like the Special Edition Monkey Islands.  I would not be surprised if DF wasn't using the same code-base to support this game.  This is all very good because Monkey Island 1/2 SE were fantastic.  This version retains the feature of being able to switch between the classic and enhanced versions of the game which is a must have for me.

DOTT is one of the products of Lucasarts' golden age of PC gaming.  I can't recommend this game enough, I had so much fun playing it when I was a kid (and Maniac Mansion that's also included).  The commentary feature is great too because it's just wonderful to hear what the constraints where when they developed this game...  Orson Welles once said: "The enemy of art is the absence of limitations" and that holds very true to these older PC games.

The only criticism I have is that the new art is vectorized, but fortunately stays true to the original material (Monkey Island 1 SE took too many artistic liberties, imo).  I'm a much bigger fan of pixel art so it would have been nice to see the pixel graphics updated, but that would have obviously been much more work.  This game will probably play better on a mobile device so you may want to wait for that, but this version is still fantastic.

22108991.review:
Day of the Tentacle Remastered signe le retour gagnant d’un des classiques, il est extrêmement plaisant de constaté le niveau de qualité du travail effectué par Double Fine pour dépoussiérer le jeu d’origine et aussi le faire découvrir à tout une génération de nouveau joueur qui n’ont pas connu la grande époque des jeux de Lucas Arts, où le jeu d’aventure était l’un des genres les plus en vogue et reconnu. S’il y a de petit défaut ici ou là il en reste une très bonne expérience qui ravira sans nul doute les connaisseurs du jeu, aussi bien que les nouveaux joueurs. Sans oublier la disponibilité de commentaires audio qui nous permettra d’en savoir plus sur la conception du jeu par ses créateurs.

22103690.review:
Un bijou.Tout simplement génial... 
J'en attendais pas moins d'un jeu culte made in Lucas Art...Je n'avais pas eu l'occasion d'y jouer lors de sa sortie en 1993 mais autant dire que le premier jour de sa précommande, j'ai sauté dessus. 

Obligé de faire le parallèle avec Grim Fandango, un P&C qui nous propulse dans une aventure originale, surprenante, loufoque et terriblement drôle. La refonte graphique est sublime, la patte cartoonesque et les animations sont tip top. Un vrai travail de mise au goût du jour qui n'a rien à envier aux jeux d'aujourd'hui (je pense à ceux de Daedalic). 
D'un seul clic, on peut revenir à la version originale, ce qui est fort plaisant. Comme GF, il y a également la possibilité d'écouter les commentaires des développeurs en cours de jeu. La bande-son colle très bien à l'ambiance générale et aux diverses situations, cela-dit, en passant par curiosité à la version originale, je dois dire que la bande-son 8bit a plus de charme. 

Comme l'on pouvait s'y attendre les énigmes sont loufoques, très loufoques. Parfois à la limite de la logique. M'enfin, pourquoi devraient-elles être logiques quand le spitch, lui, fait intervenir des voyages dans le temps via des cabines de chiottes et des tentacules gluantes géantes qui veulent conquérir le monde et réduire en esclavage l'humanité? Non, le truc, c'est que honnêtement, j'ai parfois été bloqué sur des casses-têtes qui ont mis ma patience à rude épreuve. Mais globalement, le jeu est moins compliqué qu'un Grim Fandango. 

D'un point de vu personnel, j'ai bien aimé l'ambiance mais j'ai moins accroché que celle de grim Fandango. Les personnages sont moins charismatiques (Manny Calavera et Glottis <3) 

Mais très franchement, c'est un jeu à avoir dans sa bibliothèque et sans hésitation, j'ai envie de le classer dans mes jeux d'aventures préférés.

22103352.review:
YES! FINALLY IT'S HERE. 

The game of my childhood perfectly delivered in a Remastered Edition. I LOVE the ability to F1 flick between original and remastered. The remaster job has been excellently handled. Big thanks!

22102945.review:
[h1]Pas grand chose à reprocher à ce portage d'un Point&Click d'anthologie...[/h1]

Comme “Grim Fandango” l'année dernière, Double Fine continue sur sa lancée des remasterisations des perles perdues.
Comme “Grim Fandango” l'année dernière, si on peut critiquer le côté paresseux de la démarche, force est de constater que çà fait plaisir quand même, surtout qu'il est quasiment impossible de pouvoir jouer à “Day of the Tentacle”(DotT) par des moyens légaux de nos jours...

[b]Et puis surtout parce qu'il n'a pas pris une ride![/b]

Concrètement, tous les plans ont été redessinés pour offrir au jeu une [b]meilleure résolution[/b](ce qui évitera à tout le monde de se détruire les yeux) [b]tout en gardant les animations de l'époque[/b]. Si certains trouveront le tout quand même “cheap”, çà aurait été dommage de trahir la direction artistique de l'époque en proposant un rendu qui ne fait pas l'unanimité. Son style cartoon de toute façon donne un résultat qui passe très bien, et c'est un très bon choix de leur part, bon point.
[b]L'interface a été revu également[/b]; un clique droit sur un élément où on peut interagir vous donne toutes les options possibles(les drôles et celles qui marchent). Çà rend la chose plus lisible, çà fera moins peur aux néophytes, çà laisse plus de place pour admirer les dessins... c'est tout bon.
Au pire, les puristes pourront toujours avoir le rendu et l'interface de l'époque simplement en appuyant sur F1... donc tout le monde est content!

Techniquement on a là un portage de qualité qui permet de justifié le prix pour le travail fournis et permettra au nouvelles génération de se lancer dans ce P&C tordus au possible qui reste un des plus estimé du genre encore aujourd'hui.

Le pitch de DotT annonce la couleur: le professeur Fred balance des déchets toxiques dans la rivière, qui vont faire pousser des bras à un de ses sbires, tentacule violette, et qui va se mettre en route pour conquérir le monde. Malgré l'avertissement de l'autre sbire tentacule verte, le mal est fait et la seule manière d'arrêter tentacule violette est de retourner dans le passé. Le professeur Fred va donc envoyer 3 acolytes Bernard, Hoagie et Laverne dans le passé par l'intermédiaire de chiottes temporelles... et évidemment çà va pas se passer comme prévu:
-Hoagie est envoyé au temps de Georges Washington et Ben Franklin lors de la conception de la constitution américaine
-Bernard reviens dans le présent
-Laverne est envoyée dans le futur un temps où les tentacules contrôlent le monde.
Parviendront ils a rétablir la situation, à revenir à la bonne époque pour arrêter tentacule violette et sauver le monde?

A la question “DotT est il difficile?”, la réponse est “oui et pas qu'un peu!”.
[b]Les énigmes sont à l'image du pitch du jeu, tordues, loufoques mais inoubliables.[/b]
Si on considère que le joueur contrôle les 3 lascars, sur 3 époques différentes, qu'il peut envoyer la majorité des objets de l'inventaire à chaque personnage par l'intermédiaire des Chrono'WC(en tirant la chasse bien sur... des chasses d'eau temporelles, comme dans la vrai vie), et que les énigmes sont particulièrement absurdes dans leur résolution, on tient un P&C de haute tenue qui va mettre votre patience et votre logique à mal.
Je vous encouragerait bien à le faire sans solution si je ne l'avais fait moi même(la première fois y a plus de dix ans et même ici pour ce remastered... je l'admets, je suis faible...), mais la satisfaction une fois résolue sera d'autant plus grande pour vous.
[b]C'est tellement tordu que çà en devient génial[/b], ce qu'il faut retenir!

Deux consolations pour les novices:
-les objets avec lesquels on peut interagir peuvent être mis en surbrillance en appuyant sur “tab”
-pas besoin de revenir aux toilettes pour faire passer un objet à un des 3 larrons(se fait automatiquement depuis l'inventaire en faisant un glisser/déposer sur le personnage cible)
Personnellement, je trouve çà très bien! Çà réduit au moins les chances d'être coincé pour un manque d’inattention, pas la chose la plus passionnante dans un P&C.

Si on ajoute l'ajout de commentaires audio, d'un support manette qui marche pas mal, de succès plutôt marrant à trouver et d'ébauches à débloquer, on tient un portage de haute tenue auquel [b]il serait bête de passer à côté si on est fan du genre[/b] ou si on veut découvrir parmi la crème de la crème des jeux d'aventure Lucas Arts.

[h1][u]TL;DR:[/u][/h1]

+ Un P&C d'anthologie...
+ ...remodeler graphiquement et au niveau sonore sans trahir la DA originale.
+ bon choix d'interface
+ pouvant être jouer à la manette
+ des ajouts pour une plus grande accessibilité...
+ … sans un système d'aide qui ruine tout
+ Sous titres en français et en pas mal de langues

- quelques rares bugs sonores hérités de l'original
- aurait été bien de pouvoir réattribuer les touches

22093016.review:
Hier mein Review zu Day of the Tentacle Remastered.

Eins vorab...

Für alle die dieses Spiel schon damals gespielt haben:
Keine Angst, es wurde nichts verändert ;)

Wie der Titel schon sagt ist es ein Remake eines, meiner Meinung nach, besten Spieleklassiker überhaupt.

Das Spiel wurde komplett original belassen. 

Die einzigen 2 Änderungen sind:

1. Die Grafik wurde auf ein Augenfreundliches Niveau geschraubt. Aber der Grafikstil wurde beibehalten. Des besteht auch die Möglichkeit in Originalgrafik zu spielen.

2. Man kann Entwicklerkommentare dazu schalten, aber ich denke dass ist eher für Fans von damals interessant.

Zum Spiel selbst:

Da ich nicht spoilern möchte, kann ich nur sagen: absolute Empfehlung.
Das Spiel ist liebevoll und detailreich gestaltet. Auch die Charaktere passen einfach ins Spiel, mit ihren lustigen Sprüchen und Gesten. Auch das "Rätseldesign" macht Lust auf mehr.

Für alle die dieses Spiel nicht von früher kennen....gebt dem Spiel eine Chance, es hat es verdient weiter gespielt zu werden :)

22092963.review: Day of the Tentacle is a masterpiece. The art is great, the story is great, the puzzles are great and the Tentacles are great. The remastered version makes the original game even better. This is one of the essential games for every gamer to play.

22092828.review:
Comme pour Monkey Island, Double Fine nous gratifie d'une version remasterisée de qualité.

Pas la peine de s'éterniser sur le scenario, le gameplay, etc.. c'est exactement le même jeu que dans les années 90, à la frame près, à la note près, et à la ligne de dialogue près. Toujours aussi drôle et déglingué, toujours aussi bien foutu, avec son histoire de voyage dans le temps menant les 3 principaux protagonistes à interargir malgré leur séparation de 200 ans chacun.

Néanmoins, les graphismes en haute résolution et les musiques remasterisées pourraient presque le faire passer pour une production récente. Par ailleurs, comme pour les précités remake, on peut passer à volonté de la version classique à la version remasterisée pour constater le travail effectué, ça se fait en transition douce, c'est très sympa.
L'interface fonctionne bien, c'est très propre, et il n'y a aucun bug à déplorer.

C'est donc une très bonne occasion de découvrir (ou de redécouvrir) un immense classique : l'un des tous meilleurs de l'âge d'or du point'n'click (et personnellement, mon préféré avec Monkey Island 2).
Et pour ceux qui comme moi le connaissent encore par coeur... et bien ça vaut le coup quand même :)

22087761.review:
I had this game originally on my 386 with no CDROM when I was around 8-10 years of age.  I remember it taking forever to install via the floppy disks.  When it finally finished, I had reallocated memory by creating a boot disk.  When the intro sequence started up I was blown away.   I was drawn in by the cartoon effects and music.  I must admit though, it being my adventure game it did take me a while to get the games intro sequence to continue as I didn't know how to properly use the verb Pull on the Clock.  I had to ask a buddy at school how they did it while not admitting to them that I had spent more than 2 hours trying to get it.  lol.  Once I opened up the rest of the game, I was entranced by the story, humor, sound effects, and wacky puzzles.  I learned that vinegar is created from wine via my dad.  I found uses to my Looney Tune knowledge to solve puzzles (Pepe le Pew).  I was enamoured by the all the options to talk with the great Uncle Ted.  I think this game is the reason I love all time travel games now.  

So, when I found the chance to by a remastered version of this game I jumped at it.  This game helped shape my gaming childhood.  I was estatic that I could change the graphics mode from remastered to original.  All the puzzles play the same, so if you remember them the play through will be a quick one.  I turned on commentary and learned alot about how the game was made.  Also, in the floppy version, which the commentary mentions there is only voice in the initial opening sequence in the lobby.  So, hearing all the voices of everyone to include Harold made my day.  

To sum it up, this wacky, beautiful, and awesome game will get your mind going for a short bit.  As a fan of this game and point/click adventure games, I would had bought this at any price.  However, for someone new to this I would wait for a sale, as I think $14.99 is too much for a game this short.  

That all being said though, this game is on my top 3 list of the greatest games ever made.  

Enjoy!

22086398.review:
This game was iconic for me, growing up.  It's wrapped up in my childhood memories, along with the original Monkey Island series, Leisure Suit Larry, Indiana Jones and The fate of Atlantis, and the awesome Kings Quest series.   I could only play it staying at a relatives, twice a year, as we didn't have a PC man enough to run such a game!  Over the years, I have searched for it, hoping it may have surfaced to transport me back to my youth, so you can't even imagine my excitement, to find, 23 years later, that it was available on Steam!!
I love the puzzles, the dialogue, and the characters, and the remastered version is as amazing as it always was, although slightly more polished.  
I can't recommend this game highly enough, as it's always been a favourite of mine.  The only downpoint, for me, is that it isn't longer.  I can complete it pretty quickly, and am then snapped back to reality, mid 30's, four kids, blah blah blah.  But, anyway, classic game brought back to life, and I can't thank Lucasarts enough.

22085962.review:
This is my favourite adventure game of all time. Not only does it have the amazing comedy you'd excpect from a LucasArts adventure game, it also has great characters and somewhat ridiculous puzzles and the greatest puzzle mechanic of all, Time.
The thing that sets this apart from all the other classic era of LucasArts adventure games is the scale of it all. Instead of you wandering from one puzzle area to the next this one uses the same layout of a single house but in three different eras of time. Highly recommended.

22083708.review:
[b]On the quality of the remake[/b]
This is a good exaple on how to remake a classic.
Redrawn graphics, remastered sound, and more modernised user interface, while the gameplay itself remains unchanged. And if you're a purist, you can switch everything back to the way things were back in 1993 - original pixel art, unremasterd soundtrack and traditional SCUMM(tm) interface are included for good measure too.

About the new artwork, my main gripe is that they didn't add additional animation frames - seeing high-resolution cartoons with such stiff movement is a bit weird. On the plus side, the game now looks very faithful to [url=http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/4938/609071-day_of_the_tentacle_box_front_6534x8205.jpg]the original box art[/url], something that just wasn't possible 23 years ago.

[b]On the game itself[/b]
So, how does this game hold up, 2 decades later ? This is one of the most well-known point & click adventures from the '90s after all...
The good news is that after all those years, it still shows why it's a classic. It offers a non-linear approach to puzzles, plenty of funny jokes, an insane plot and a lot of hints towards the more illogical puzzles if you're willing to explore, experiment, and pay attention to details.
Yep, illogical puzzles. But this game is illogical in a consist way, so it could be said to run on it's own internal logic instead. Explore everywhere, get hint in one place of the game, apply the hint elsewhere, get unexpected, and probably hilarious effect. 
Or when you know what effect to achieve, find items you need where you would not expect them at first, and put them to use.

[b]Bottom line[/b]
If you're a fan of point & click adventures, you should own Day of the Tentacle.

22083327.review:
Damals, in grauer Vorzeit, anno 1993, kam ich das erste mal in den Genuss von Day of the Tentacle- kurz DOTT. Es war für mich das erste Adventure, und viele weitere sollten folgen. Dennoch ist DOTT für mich eines der besten Adventures aller Zeiten! 

Die Story rund um machthungrige Tentakel und Zeitreisen ist wirklich verrückt, die Dialoge herrlich humorvoll und die Modernisierung ist sehr gelungen. An dieser Stelle vielen Dank an Double Fine- great work!

22083215.review:
Éste es quizás el mejor juego de aventura tipo Point-and-click que se ha hecho nunca (con el permiso de Monkey Island 1 y 2). 100% recomendado, claro!!

Aunque advierto que mi opinión puede estar muy sesgada, ya que me considero fan incondicional del juego desde que lo jugué por allá el 1996, cuando era niño. Lo habré jugado como unas 8-10 veces (sin contar esta versión remasterizada): en PC 486, en Win9x, en iOS jail-break, en ScummVM (en modo original y en modo subida de resolución juntando píxeles para hacer que se vea "menos" pixelado), etc.

El juego es divertido, intuitivo y no tan largo como los Monkey, lo que para mi lo hace mejor que estos dos. La estética es atractiva, los diálogos son divertidos, los puzzles son suficientemente intuitivos como para no estancarse demasiado, los personajes son únicos, la historia es hilarante y la conexión entre el pasado, presente y futuro es sublime, ¿qué más se puede pedir a una aventura point&click?

En esta versión remasterizada, han hecho exactamente lo que tenían que hacer: respetar al 100% el original, adaptando los gráficos a las pantallas HD, pero manteniendo exactamente la misma estética (tipo de dibujo) que el original, la cual, a pesar de sus píxeles, seguía siendo aceptable hoy en día. El sistema de verbos original ha sido cambiado (se puede activar el modo original) por la típica ruleta para facilitar la vida a los que juegan con mando (consolas), pero sinceramente, eso permite ver la pantalla al 100% y es mucho más ágil a la hora de interactuar con el entorno. El acceso al inventario es muy rápido y sencillo, no cansa.

Para mencionar alguna pega, podrían haberse currado versiones orquestadas de la música y doblajes en otros idiomas, pero supongo que no se puede tener todo.

22083212.review:

22075382.review:
Wonderful version of one of the greatest games ever. The graphics have been masterfully remastered, including subpixel scrolling for an ultra-smooth experience. The voices have been re-sampled from the original DAT recordings and are crystal clear. You can switch between the original presentation and the remastered one anywhere with a single keypress. Technically this version is perfect.

If forced to critique anything about the game, it would have to be the subtitle sync which seems slightly off, with longer sentences staying on screen long after they've been uttered. A subtitle speed slider would solve this.

Highly recommended.

22055420.review:
If you're not familiar with Day of the Tentacle (DoTT) already, the best way to describe it is as the love child of Adult Swim and modern Telltale Games like Tales from the Borderlands. Day of the Tentacle is also one of the most important adventure games ever made, and for good reason. 

Even without the nostalgia-filtered lenses, Day of the Tentacle stands as one of cleverest and funniest games I've ever played. The writing is filled with quirky charm, and the puzzles strike a perfect balance between cartoon logic, humor, and absurdity--even if they stump you for a bit, save the walkthrough until you're *really* stuck, because there's a lot of excitement and laughs in figuring the puzzles out yourself. The remaster is absolutely visually gorgeous and should be the standard that all remasters are held to; the sound is similarly spectacular and the voice acting is tremendous. 

The only two reasons NOT to get this game are: 1) If you hate adventure games, because DotT is basically just collecting items, manipulating them, and talking to people; and 2) If you're really strapped for cash, because, while I think the price is very reasonable, some people might complain that <10 hrs of content for the price is steep. 

But, seriously, if neither of the above apply, buy this game and start playing now.

22054427.review:
Before I say anything like "I really wanted to like this" I must confess to being on of THOSE people who apparently couldnt adjust to modern times.

I tried to play the remastered way but the "cutout" filter effect from photoshop was a major turnoff. The "remastered" soundtrack also and dont get me started on how the unintuitive interface got even more destroyed by the ugly new font. All I can say is "Thank god for the option to play it like it was intended".

These were my major issues and it seems to me that the things I wanted just wasnt there in this remake. To bring some perspective to the issues I mentioned I might add that I absolutely adored the remakes of Monkey Island, especially the graphics and the sound (not the interface). This remake is another beast however.

DotT is however still one of the best adventure games around so Im gonna give it a thumbs up nonetheless. The final judgement is however based on the original (and I do own the original in a box), nothing in this so called "remake effort" would get a thumbs up from me.

J'ai toujours aimé ce jeu à l'époque, et le travail fait pour le remasteriser est tout simplement merveilleux. Il est toujours possible de switcher en mode non masterisé à tout moment en appuyant sur F1, on reviens à l'écran 4:3 pixélisé original du jeu avec les sons originaux et le panneau des actions en bas. 

C'est un immense fun de redécouvrir ce grand classic, encore le fun d'y jouer, avec des graphiques pas pixelisés et des musiques d'excellente sonorité. Très heureux de mon achat, et merci énormément d'avoir remasterisé ce bon classique !

22053959.review:
Als erstes möchte ich sagen, dass ich dieses Spiel damals schon gespielt habe. Es war mit unter mein erstes Spiel in meiner Laufbahn als PC-Spieler. 

Für alle die sich den Review ersparen wollen, hier die erste Stunde Playtime.

https://youtu.be/P449LxiHfzw

Day of the Tentacle ist ein Point and Click Adventure das noch immer mit den heutigen Titeln wie Deponia locker mithalten kann. (Für Point and Click Adventure Fans ist die Deponia Reihe zu empfehlen)
Es sieht super aus ( Remastered = Grafik überarbeitet aber Story gleich geblieben).
Das UI (Userinterface) ist überarbeitet und wesentlich nutzerfreundlicher als die Urfassung.
Kleine Ungenauigkeiten ( KEINE BUGS/FEHLER) sind aus Nostalgiegründen weiter enthalten. Darunter fällt zum Beispiel die nicht vorhandene Synchronität der Sprachausgabe ( Es ist minimal aber erklärt durch Entwickler Kommentare)
Die Entwicklerkommentare sind sehr interessant und unterhaltsam. Ich persönlich habe diese deaktiviert, da diese für ein Let's Play eher störend sind!

Für alle Retrofans ist gesagt, dass man Ingame die Grafik wechseln kann zwischen Oldschool und neuer Grafik. Wirklich lustig sich die Szenen anzuschauen und zu vergleichen :)

Allem in Allem ist es Lohnenswert dieses Spiel noch einmal zu spielen!
Grafik 10/10
Story 10/10 (wie schon immer)
Fun-Faktor 10/10 (Sofern man auf diese Art von Humor steht)
Preis-Leistungsverhältnis 8/10 (Wenn man es schon gespielt hat)

Von mir eine klare Kaufempfehlung!

I'm about 20 years too late to write a fresh review of DOTT. It's probably one of Lucas Arts' finest point & clicks - genuinly funny, awesome sound design and a tremendous Chuck Jonesque art direction.

If you have never played the original, buy it RIGHT NOW.

If you have already completed the game, some questions are in order:
-Do you enjoy developer commentaries ?
-Do you like "HD" grafix ?
-Do you care about achievements ?

If you have a majority of "no", it might be wise to just stick to your old copy. Because those are the main perks of this versions.

The only real drawback of this remastered is the stupid "continue" system for the original Maniac Mansion. You can't save and only resume the current game. So if you're stuck in a a dead end, might as well restart.

22040008.review:
Da gusto volver a los viejos tiempos en uno de los mejores títulos y con mejor historia que he jugado en mi vida.
Volvemos a ponernos en la piel de Bernard Bernoulli, el tipico nerd de pelicula, Hoagie, un rockero tipico de la época y Laverne,... supuestamente una enfermera pero yo no me dejaría poner por sus manos... para salvar el mundo de una de las craciones del Dr. Fred, el tentáculo morado.

Quizás echo en falta un avance en la historia más que una versión remastered, pero ahora que han vuelto a trabajar con el creador original del juego para remasterizarlo, quizás veamos en el futuro un nuevo título para ver que ocurre con el la familia Edison.

Además, como muchos sabréis, podremos disfrutar del primer título de la saga - "Maniac Mansion" dentro del juego y en versión original. Además de poder jugar a este último título en su versión original también (Pixelada).

Echo en falta que adhieran al juego los audios del juego extraídos.

Si queréis vivir una verdadera aventura gráfica de antaño, con mucho humor y estrujaros el cerebro para resolver los complicados puzles, este es el mejor título que podréis comprar este 2016.

22032538.review:
Nach all den Jahren endlich mal wieder!

Ohne ScummVM oder sonstige Hilfsmittel einen der größten Klassiker und vor allem eines der großartigsten Spiele der Kindheit mal wieder spielen. Wie schon bei Grim Fandango Remastered ohne zu zögern zugegriffen und es keine Sekunde bereut! Auch wenn ich tatsächlich noch alle Rätsel auswendig kannte und dementsprechend recht fix durch war, ist mir allein die Nostalgie die 14,99€ wert.

Was soll man groß sagen? Es ist das klassische Point-and-klick-Adventure mit aufgehübschter Grafik und nachbearbeiteten Soundeffekten. In der überarbeiteten Version hat man allerdings nicht mehr die alten Verben am unteren Bildschirmrand wie "Nimm", "Ziehe", "Rede" usw, sondern es werden kontextsensitiv passende Verben mit einem Klick der rechten Maustaste in einem Kreismenü angezeigt. Diese Neuerung mag man nun mehr oder weniger sinnvoll finden, störend ist sie jedenfalls nicht.

Am Ende kann man das Spiel sowohl für denjenigen empfehlen, der diesen Klassiker damals schon liebte, als auch für den neuen Spieler, der ihn nachholen möchte oder einfach auf verrückten Humor steht.
